snippet: Jeb Bush, Chris Christie and John R. Kasich are trying to climb their way back in the presidential race by winning over voters with personal encounters in small towns, schools and senior centers.
abstract: Republican presidential candidates Jeb Bush, Chris Christie and John Kasich, all of whom are trailing in polls, are staking their fortunes on face-to-face encounters in New Hampshire, long thought to influence direction of race; idea is coming into question in competition dominated by social media and televised debates between large field of contenders.
lead_paragraph: Jeb Bush, Chris Christie and John R. Kasich are trying to climb their way back in the presidential race by winning over voters with personal encounters in small towns, schools and senior centers.

headline.main: G.O.P. Candidates, Lagging, Rely on New Hampshire to Get Close
headline.print_headline: Weak in Polls and Betting All on 1 State
